value_claims.claim_title: Ramp achieved $22.5 billion valuation through AI-powered finance automation
value_claims.claim_description: Ramp reached a $22.5 billion valuation after raising $700 million in funding to accelerate AI investments in corporate finance automation, positioning itself as a leader in agentic AI for finance operations.
value_claims.source_quote: The fresh funding gave Ramp a $22.5 billion valuation.
value_claims.attribution_evidence: The valuation is directly tied to AI investments, with CEO stating the raise is to accelerate AI adoption and the company releasing AI-powered autonomous finance agents.

value_claims.claim_title: Ramp customers reduce expenses by 3.5% annually using AI-powered platform
value_claims.claim_description: Companies using Ramp's integrated expense management and accounting automation solution achieve an average 3.5% reduction in annual expenses through automated spend optimization and control.
value_claims.source_quote: Our service helps the average company cut their expenses by 3.5% per year
value_claims.attribution_evidence: While the platform includes AI capabilities, the 3.5% savings result from the integrated solution including expense management, bill payments, and accounting automation.

value_claims.claim_title: Ramp accelerates month-end close processes by 8 days using automation
value_claims.claim_description: Ramp's automated accounting and expense management solution speeds up financial closing and consolidation processes by 8 days per month for average customers.
value_claims.source_quote: speed up month-end close processes by 8 days each month
value_claims.attribution_evidence: The acceleration is achieved through accounting automation and streamlined processes, which include AI capabilities as part of the integrated platform.

value_claims.claim_title: 1,000+ finance teams reclaim 4-5 hours weekly using Ramp Policy Agent
value_claims.claim_description: Over 1,000 finance teams using Ramp's AI Policy Agent automate expense reviews, saving 4-5 hours per week previously spent on manual review processes.
value_claims.source_quote: More than 1,000 finance teams now use the Ramp Policy Agent, reclaiming 4-5 hours per week from manual reviews
value_claims.attribution_evidence: The time savings are explicitly attributed to the AI Policy Agent automating expense reviews that were previously manual.

value_claims.claim_title: Ramp Policy Agent catches 7x more out-of-policy spend than manual reviews
value_claims.claim_description: The AI-powered Policy Agent identifies seven times more policy violations and out-of-policy spending compared to traditional manual expense review processes.
value_claims.attribution_evidence: The improved detection is directly attributed to the AI Policy Agent's capabilities versus manual review methods.

value_claims.claim_title: 1,000+ teams adopted Ramp's AI Policy Agent for expense automation
value_claims.claim_description: More than 1,000 finance teams have adopted Ramp's AI Policy Agent to automate expense review processes, demonstrating significant market adoption of the AI capability.
value_claims.source_quote: More than 1,000 finance teams now use the Ramp Policy Agent
value_claims.attribution_evidence: The adoption metric specifically refers to the AI Policy Agent, a direct AI capability.

value_claims.claim_title: Ramp reduces manual expense approval process from 14 minutes to automated
value_claims.claim_description: AI agents eliminate the traditional 14-minute, $20 manual approval process for individual expenses, automating busywork across thousands of monthly transactions.
value_claims.source_quote: The manual process requires 14 minutes and $20 of human intervention cost for questions, approvals, audits and coding of the coffee expense.
value_claims.attribution_evidence: CEO explicitly describes AI agents assuming the busywork of finance functions, eliminating the manual 14-minute process.

value_claims.claim_title: Ramp raised $1.9 billion in venture funding since 2019
value_claims.claim_description: Ramp secured $1.9 billion in total venture funding since its 2019 establishment, with $700 million raised in two months specifically for AI investments in corporate finance automation.
value_claims.source_quote: Ramp has raised $1.9 billion in venture funding since it was established in 2019
value_claims.attribution_evidence: While total funding includes pre-AI investments, the recent $700M was explicitly for AI capabilities, and investor statements cite AI leadership as key to investment.

value_claims.claim_title: Ramp processes billions of dollars in purchases annually on AI-powered platform
value_claims.claim_description: Ramp's platform, built on Stripe Issuing and enhanced with AI capabilities, powers billions of dollars in corporate purchases each year across over 100 countries.
value_claims.source_quote: power billions of dollars of purchases each year
value_claims.attribution_evidence: The platform includes AI-powered expense management and automation capabilities that contribute to processing this transaction volume.

value_claims.claim_title: Ramp AI agents enable real-world policy enforcement and fraud detection
value_claims.claim_description: Ramp's autonomous AI agents, released in July, are built specifically for real-world policy enforcement, fraud detection, and policy improvement in corporate finance operations.
value_claims.source_quote: The bots are built for real-world policy enforcement, fraud detection, and policy improvement
value_claims.attribution_evidence: The capabilities are explicitly described as built into AI-powered autonomous finance agents.

context_claims.claim_description: Ramp was established in 2019 as a corporate finance automation startup.
context_claims.source_quote: Ramp has raised $1.9 billion in venture funding since it was established in 2019

context_claims.claim_title: Ramp released first AI-powered autonomous finance agents in July 2024
context_claims.claim_description: The company launched its initial AI-powered autonomous finance agents in July, marking entry into agentic AI for finance.
context_claims.source_quote: The company released its first AI-powered autonomous finance agents in July.

context_claims.claim_title: Ramp raised $700 million in less than two months for AI investments
context_claims.claim_description: Ramp raised $200 million followed by $500 million within 45 days, totaling $700 million specifically for AI acceleration.
context_claims.source_quote: AI robots are coming for expense accounts – and fintech startup Ramp has raised $700 million in less than two months to help speed the adoption of automation tools in corporate finances.

context_claims.claim_description: Ramp is based in New York City.

context_claims.claim_title: Eric Glyman is co-founder and CEO of Ramp
context_claims.claim_description: Eric Glyman serves as co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Ramp.
context_claims.source_quote: Ramp's co-founder and CEO, Eric Glyman

context_claims.claim_description: Ramp is a fintech startup focused on corporate finance automation and expense management.
Ramp offers corporate clients tools for expense management, including corporate cards and spend analysis.
context_claims.source_quote: offers corporate clients tools that handle tasks such as expense management, accounting, travel and procurement along with corporate cards and software to analyze and optimize corporate spending

context_claims.claim_description: Ramp offers accounting automation capabilities including month-end close processes and financial consolidation.
context_claims.source_quote: integrated expense management, bill payments, and accounting automation solution

context_claims.claim_description: Ramp offers procurement tools and workflows for corporate purchasing and vendor management.
context_claims.source_quote: offers corporate clients tools that handle tasks such as expense management, accounting, travel and procurement

context_claims.claim_title: Ramp aims to lead in agentic AI for finance
context_claims.claim_description: Ramp's strategic intent is to lead the market in agentic AI and set the standard for AI-powered finance operations.
context_claims.source_quote: We believe Ramp is leading in agentic AI and setting the standard for what AI-powered finance can look like in the coming years

context_claims.claim_title: Ramp offers corporate card issuing services
context_claims.claim_description: Ramp provides branded corporate purchasing cards with global distribution capabilities across over 100 countries.
context_claims.source_quote: we're able to ship custom-printed, high-quality metal cards with short delivery timelines to over 100 countries

context_claims.claim_title: Ramp serves businesses of all sizes globally
context_claims.claim_description: Ramp's platform serves corporate clients ranging from small businesses to large enterprises across over 100 countries.
context_claims.source_quote: Ramp wanted to give businesses of all sizes a better corporate card experience

context_claims.claim_title: Ramp competes with Airbase, BILL, and Brex
context_claims.claim_description: Ramp's competitive landscape includes fintech companies Airbase, BILL, and Brex in the corporate finance automation space.
context_claims.source_quote: New York-based Ramp – like rivals that include Airbase, BILL and Brex

context_claims.claim_title: Iconiq Capital led Ramp's $500M funding round
context_claims.claim_description: Investment firm Iconiq Capital led Ramp's $500 million funding round, with participation from GV, T. Rowe Price, and Emerson Collective.
context_claims.source_quote: Investment firm Iconiq Capital led the funding round, along with the firms that invested in June and seven new investors that included Emerson Collective...GV (Google Ventures); and T. Rowe Price Associates.

context_claims.claim_title: Ramp built on Stripe Issuing infrastructure
context_claims.claim_description: Ramp's card issuing and payment infrastructure is built on Stripe Issuing platform.
context_claims.source_quote: With Stripe Issuing, Ramp lets businesses quickly issue branded purchasing cards across the globe
